ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I improved my Indonesian speaking skills and overall knowledge about the language and I learned a lot about the Indonesian culture!
Saya belajar bahasa Indonesia dan berlatih membaca bahasa Indonesia.
Practice in speaking, listening, and writing Indonesian

I learned about Indonesian culture and language. This class was extremely engaging. I now know the Indonesian president, capital, and currency among other things. I feel much better equipped to travel to Bali or Jakarta.
more adept in speaking and writing in Indonesian

I learnt a lot of Indonesian language, as well as also became much more aware and appreciative of Indonesia's culture and history (we had particular topics on Indonesia's past, as well as learning about Ibu Kartini, a key feminist figure in education.
Gained a strong foundation in speaking, reading, and writing the Indonesian language
Indonesian vocabulary

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It is a great class and Pak Indriyo does a great job keeping students engaged.
No weaknesses, only strengths. The only way it could be improved is if it lasted longer
This course is my favorite course at Yale. It is fun, engaging, and insightful. The material is well-structured and provides a great learning environment for all who take this course.
Class was always fun and engaging.  All assignments were graded fairly
Weaknesses- could have more classes that teach us about the culture of Indonesia such as the dances, arts, food tasting etc., instead of just the last day.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes 100%. Pak Indriyo is one of the kindest, most caring teachers ever. We always have so much fun in class while learning a lot about both the Indonesian language and culture.
Yes if you are looking for a language course, Indonesian is a fun language to learn and Pak Indriyo does a great job teaching it.
Yes and put some effort into learning the language. Its a simple and fun language so just try a little and itll pay off so much
Yes! Easy to learn class.

I would wholeheartedly recommend this question another student because this is my favorite course at Yale. Pak indriyo does an amazing job of creating a fun and engaging learning environment. I learned so much not only about Indonesian language but Indonesian culture as well.
Yes, Pak Indriyo is the best.  Class was so much fun with very little stress
Heck yea, I loved Pak Indriyo and am sad to seem him go.
